evidence_items.text: A tug driving instructor (tug instructor) and trainee tug driver (trainee driver) were seated beside each other in the tug. The flight crew were in communication with the headset operator via the aircraft’s interphone.
The trainee driver decided to stop the pushback and asked the tug instructor to take over.

After swapping seats the instructor recommenced the pushback, correcting the aircraft back onto the taxiway centreline. He continued to reassure and advise the trainee while performing the pushback, looking at her while doing so. The headset operator continued walking on the right side of the tug, abeam its cabin. The wingman was on the left just ahead of the tug.

The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.
The tug instructor pulled the aircraft forward off the fence then stopped the tug.

roots_spec.exclusion_clause: Not explained by any other root

slot_statements.defeater_resistance: The explanation of communication/coordination breakdown among crew is resistant to defeaters given the context of the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA incident on 12-25 in the early historical timeline, as alternative causes do not sufficiently account for the observed coordination failures.
slot_statements.fit_to_key_features: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew aligns with key features observed in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA incident on 12-25 during the early historical timeline, indicating a failure in crew interaction and coordination.

slot_statements.availability: The environmental or marking deficiency must be present and observable in the Boeing 737-8AS with registration 9H-QAA during the historical time frame hist_t1_early on 12-25.

slot_statements.fit_to_key_features: The environmental or marking deficiency must align with the key features and characteristics defined for the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA in the hist_t1_early period.

slot_statements.fit_to_key_features: Mechanical/control failure fits the key features observed in Boeing_737-8AS_9H-QAA_12-25:hist_t1_early.

slot_statements.availability: The procedural deviation in pushback execution is observable and documented within the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA during the historical timeframe hist_t1_early on 12-25.
slot_statements.defeater_resistance: The identification of procedural deviation in pushback execution is robust against potential counterarguments or alternative explanations within the context of Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA's hist_t1_early operations.
slot_statements.fit_to_key_features: The procedural deviation in pushback execution aligns with the key features and operational characteristics specific to the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA during the hist_t1_early period.

node.statement: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew occurred during the early phase of the historical timeline (hist_t1_early) for the Boeing 737-8AS with registration 9H-QAA on 12-25.

assumptions: The early phase corresponds to the pushback phase described in the history items
defeaters: Explicit evidence of communication or coordination failure during the early phase
Statements indicating smooth or effective communication during the early phase

quotes.exact_quote: The flight crew were in communication with the headset operator via the aircraft’s interphone.
The trainee driver decided to stop the pushback and asked the tug instructor to take over.

After swapping seats the instructor recommenced the pushback, correcting the aircraft back onto the taxiway centreline. He continued to reassure and advise the trainee while performing the pushback, looking at her while doing so.

outcome.reasoning_summary: Evidence shows communication between flight crew and headset operator and coordination between tug instructor and trainee during pushback (H1, H2, H3), but no direct indication of a communication/coordination breakdown in the early phase.
outcome.uncertainty_source: No direct evidence explicitly describing communication breakdown; only indirect context about communication and coordination.

defeaters: Evidence showing mechanical or control system malfunction or failure during the event.
outcome.reasoning_summary: No evidence indicates any mechanical or control failure in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA during the early historical timeframe; the evidence describes tug driver actions and aircraft movement without mention of mechanical/control failure.

node.statement: The environmental or marking deficiency must be present and observable in the Boeing 737-8AS with registration 9H-QAA during the historical time frame hist_t1_early on 12-25.

defeaters: If evidence showed visible or documented environmental or marking deficiencies at the TRP or surrounding area during the incident.
outcome.reasoning_summary: No evidence in the provided history items indicates the presence or observability of an environmental or marking deficiency on the Boeing 737-8AS with registration 9H-QAA during the specified timeframe.

node.statement: The procedural deviation in pushback execution is observable and documented within the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA during the historical timeframe hist_t1_early on 12-25.

defeaters: If evidence showed the aircraft stopped correctly at the TRP without incident
If no documentation or observation of the deviation existed in the historical record

quotes.exact_quote: The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.

outcome.reasoning_summary: H4 directly documents a procedural deviation during pushback execution as the aircraft moved beyond the designated Tug release point and hit a blast barrier, confirming observability and documentation within the specified timeframe and aircraft.

node.statement: The procedural deviation in pushback execution aligns with the key features and operational characteristics specific to the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA during the hist_t1_early period.

assumptions: The TRP ground markings represent the standard procedural limit for pushback
Hitting the blast barrier indicates a deviation from normal procedure
defeaters: If evidence showed that the continued movement beyond the TRP was an accepted or documented procedure for this aircraft and period
If operational manuals or standard procedures for the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA during hist_t1_early allowed or expected such deviation

quotes.exact_quote: The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.

outcome.reasoning_summary: Evidence H4 shows the aircraft moved beyond the designated tug release point and hit a blast barrier, indicating a procedural deviation that does not align with expected operational characteristics for the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA during the hist_t1_early period.
